If you're looking for a thought-provoking film that explores themes of identity and survival, I'd recommend "We the Living". This classic Russian drama follows three characters as they navigate the tumultuous landscape of the Revolution, grappling with their own personal demons and the harsh realities of dictatorship.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something a bit more light-hearted yet still emotionally resonant, "Holes" might be just what you need. This quirky coming-of-age tale follows two young men on a journey of self-discovery and redemption, featuring a talented cast and some seriously memorable characters!
